intro: Tsiorchis wangii, commonly known as the Guangxi lily, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces a single, tall flowering stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tsiorchis wangii is considered a conservation concern.
